<file id="186" change="false">
<text id="0">
	Welcome to the Battle Park!\rIt’s your first time, isn’t it?\nPlease step this way.\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	Since this is your first visit, you\nneed to be given a Point Card.\rPoint Cards are used only in\nthe Battle Park.\rHere you go.\r
</text>
<text id="2">
	If you need information on the Point\nCard, please ask the receptionist\lnext to me.\rI’m the one to ask if you need any\ninformation on the facilities here\lin the Battle Park.\rFor information on the battle rules\nused at the Battle Park, please ask\lthe receptionist across from me.\r
</text>
<text id="3">
	Welcome to the Battle Park!\rIf you need any information on the\nfacilities, I’m the one to ask.\r
</text>
<text id="4">
	What would you like me to explain?
</text>
<text id="5">
	The Battle Park is a place where\nTrainers may enjoy battles.\rThere are two facilities in\nthe Battle Park: the Exchange Service\lCorner and the Battle Tower.\r
</text>
<text id="6">
	The Exchange Service Corner is the\nbuilding that looks like a castle.\rThere, you may exchange the BP\n(Battle Points) you’ve earned for\litems.\rFabulous prizes are offered, so\nplease do visit the Exchange Service\lCorner when you save up BP.\r
</text>
<text id="7">
	The Battle Tower is the building\nat the back of the Battle Park.\rThe tower has four sets of Battle\nRooms for different kinds of battles.\rThe Single Battle Rooms are for\nconducting one-on-one battles.\rThe Double Battle Rooms are for\ntwo-on-two battles.\rThe Multi Battle Rooms are for\ntag team battles with a partner.\rThe Wi-Fi Battle Rooms are for\nbattling other Trainers from around\lthe world.\r
</text>
<text id="8">
	Welcome to the Battle Park!\rI can explain how the Point Card and\nthe BP (Battle Points) work.\r
</text>
<text id="9">
	What would you like me to explain?
</text>
<text id="10">
	Every Trainer visiting the Battle Park\nis provided with a Point Card that\lconfirms their challenger status.\rThe Point Card stores BP (Battle\nPoints) that you earn from battling\lin the Battle Tower.\r
</text>
<text id="11">
	BP, short for Battle Points, are used\nonly in the Battle Park.\rYou will earn BP by hitting certain\nperformance targets battling at\lthe Battle Tower.\rThe BP can be traded for prizes at\nthe Exchange Service Corner.\r
</text>
<text id="12">
	Welcome to the Battle Park!\rI can give you a rundown of the\nbattle rules that are used at\lthe Battle Tower.\r
</text>
<text id="13">
	What would you like me to explain?
</text>
<text id="14">
	In the Battle Tower, you may enter\nPokémon in battles that are capped\lat Lv. 50.\rPokémon up to Lv. 50 may be entered\nwith a few exceptions.\rPokémon above Lv. 50 may also be\nentered, but their level will be\lcut to Lv. 50 in the Battle Tower.\rThe reduced level will be restored\nwhen you leave the Battle Tower.\rPlease keep in mind that your\nopponents will not use Pokémon below\lLv. 50.\r
</text>
<text id="15">
	Excluding Eggs and certain exotic\nPokémon, virtually every species of\lPokémon may enter the Battle Tower.\rPlease be aware that the number of\nPokémon you may enter will depend\lon the course you challenge.\rYou are also permitted to take only\none of each kind of Pokémon into\lthe Battle Tower.\r
</text>
<text id="16">
	Your Pokémon may not be holding the\nsame kind of item in the Battle\lTower.\rPlease be sure the Pokémon entering\nthe Battle Tower are all holding\ldifferent items.\r
</text>
<text id="17">
	Good luck!
</text>

	Welcome to the Battle Park!

<text id="3">
	Welcome to the Contest Hall.\rI can help you with registering\nfor a Super Contest.\r
</text>
<text id="4">
	Would you like to enter a Pokémon\nin a Contest?
</text>
<text id="5">
	What would you like to know about?
</text>
<text id="6">
	    
</text>
<text id="7">
	Welcome to the Contest Hall!\rThis is the reception counter for\nlinked Super Contests.\rYou may join a group of friends to\nenter your Pokémon in the same\lSuper Contest over a link.\r
</text>
<text id="8">
	ENTER
</text>
<text id="9">
	INFO
</text>
<text id="10">
	EXIT
</text>
<text id="11">
	We look forward to your participation\nanother time!
</text>
<text id="12">
	Would you like to\nenter a link Contest?
</text>
<text id="13">
	Two to four players may compete\nover a link.\rFirst, choose the Contest you wish\nto enter.\rNext, make sure the other people in\nyour group choose the same Contest.\rThen, the players each choose a\nPokémon to enter the Contest, and\lthat’s it for registration!\rAfter that, the Contest starts in\nthe usual way.\rWe hope you’ll try it out.\r
</text>
<text id="14">
	A Pokémon Super Contest involves\nfour Trainers.\rEach one enters a Pokémon to\ncompete against the others.\rJudging is conducted in three\ncategories: Visual, Dance, and\lActing.\rThe Pokémon scoring the highest in\nthe three categories is the winner.\rIf this is your first time, it is\nrecommended you try some practice\lsessions before entering a Contest.\rThe registration counter for practice\nsessions is at the far right.\r
</text>
<text id="15">
	In the Visual Competition, Pokémon\nare rated on their appearance.\rScoring is based on votes cast by\nthe audience.\rFor details, please inquire at the\npractice counter on the right.\r
</text>
<text id="16">
	In the Dance Competition, the Pokémon\nwill get to show off their footwork.\rTry to put on coordinated dance\nperformances with everyone!\rFor details, please inquire at the\npractice counter on the right.\r
</text>
<text id="17">
	In the Acting Competition, the\nPokémon will perform their moves in\lfront of Judges.\rTry to get your Pokémon to put on\nperformances that stand out from the\lrest of the pack!\rFor details, please inquire at the\npractice counter on the right.\r
</text>
<text id="18">
	There are five Contests in all:\nCool, Beauty, Cute, Smart, and Tough.\rBe sure to choose the Contest that\nbest suits the Pokémon you want to\lenter with.\r
</text>
<text id="19">
	There are four different ranks to\nthe Pokémon Super Contests.\rThe four ranks are Normal, Great,\nUltra, and Master.\rThe Normal Rank is open for entry\nby any Pokémon.\rA Pokémon winning a Normal Rank\nContest may move up to the Great\lRank in the same category.\rLikewise, win a Great Contest and\nbecome eligible for the Ultra Rank.\rAn Ultra Rank winner may move up to\nthe Master Rank in the same way.\rA Master Rank winner may enter\nMaster Rank Contests as often as\lthe Trainer wishes.\r
</text>
<text id="20">
	Which Pokémon would you like to\nenter?\r
</text>
<text id="21">
	Please choose\na Pokémon.\r
</text>

<text id="111">
	Hi! This is the registration counter\nfor practice sessions.\rYou may practice in the categories\nof Visual, Dance, and Acting.\r
</text>
<text id="112">
	Would you like to join a practice\nsession?
</text>
<text id="113">
	PRACTICE
</text>
<text id="114">
	INFO
</text>
<text id="115">
	EXIT
</text>
<text id="116">
	We look forward to your next visit!
</text>
<text id="117">
	What would you like to know about?
</text>
<text id="118">
	VISUAL
</text>
<text id="119">
	DANCE
</text>
<text id="120">
	ACTING
</text>
<text id="121">
	PRACTICE
</text>
<text id="122">
	CANCEL
</text>
<text id="123">
	We look forward to your next visit!
</text>
<text id="124">
	A Contest involves judging in three\ncategories: Visual, Dance, and\lActing.\rHere you may practice each of these\ncategories before you actually enter\la real Contest.\rThere’s just one thing. Your Pokémon\nmust know at least two moves.\rOtherwise, it will not qualify for our\nSuper Contests.\r
</text>
<text id="125">
	OVERALL FLOW
</text>
<text id="126">
	CONDITION POINTS
</text>
<text id="127">
	DRESS-UP POINTS
</text>
<text id="128">
	    
</text>
<text id="129">
	CANCEL
</text>
<text id="130">
	Judging here is based on the visual\nappeal of Pokémon.\rScoring is based on voting by the\naudience.\rThe more popular the Pokémon, the\nhigher its score!\rThe Pokémon are scored in two\ncategories: Condition Points and\lDress-up Points.\r
</text>
<text id="131">
	Condition Points are scored on\nthe Pokémon’s condition in one of\lfive categories.\rThe five conditions are: Cool, Beauty,\nCute, Smart, and Tough.\rThese conditions can be enhanced by\nfeeding Poffins to your Pokémon.\rIf the audience likes what they see,\n\vFF00\x0001\x0001♥\vFF00\x0001\x0000 marks will appear.\rObviously, the more \vFF00\x0001\x0001♥\vFF00\x0001\x0000 marks there\nare, the more popular the Pokémon.\r
</text>
<text id="132">
	Dress-up Points are awarded for\nfashionably dressing up your Pokémon\lwith Accessories.\rBefore you begin, you will be given\na fashion theme.\rYour dressed-up Pokémon will be\nscored on how well it matches the\lassigned theme.\rThe audience’s approval will appear\nas pink \vFF00\x0001\x0001♥\vFF00\x0001\x0000 marks.\rBe sure to position the Accessories\nproperly and attach them firmly.\lThey won’t stay on otherwise.\rThere is a time limit of 60 seconds.\rGet your Pokémon dressed up within\nthat time.\r
</text>
<text id="133">
	    
</text>
<text id="134">
	We look forward to your next visit!
</text>
<text id="135">
	OVERALL FLOW
</text>
<text id="136">
	BACKUP DANCER
</text>
<text id="137">
	MAIN DANCER
</text>
<text id="138">
	PANEL
</text>
<text id="139">
	CANCEL
</text>
<text id="140">
	In a Dance Competition, the four\ncontestants take on different parts.\rOne becomes the main dancer, and the\nremaining three are backup dancers.\rThe main dancer scores points by\nperforming inspired dance steps\lthat the others can’t copy.\rThe backup dancers earn high scores\nby duplicating the dance steps\llaid down by the main dancer.\r
</text>
<text id="141">
	Your Pokémon will first appear as\na backup dancer.\rMake it dance using the same timing\nas the main dancer.\rUse the castanets to show your\nPokémon which direction the main\ldancer turned.\r
</text>
<text id="142">
	The main dancer rotates with a\nbackup dancer so everyone gets\la turn.\rWhen your Pokémon is the main dancer,\nshow it how to dance!\r
</text>
<text id="143">
	The melody will be shown playing on\nthe red and blue panels.\rThe panel colors show who should be\ndancing.\rThe main dancer can dance while the\nmelody is in the blue panels.\rBackup dancers must dance only\nduring the red panels.\rThe dancers must perform the\nrequired number of dance steps\lduring their time slots.\r
</text>
<text id="144">
	We look forward to your next visit!
</text>
<text id="145">
	OVERALL FLOW
</text>
<text id="146">
	CONTEST MOVES
</text>
<text id="147">
	JUDGES
</text>
<text id="148">
	VOLTAGE
</text>
<text id="149">
	CANCEL
</text>
<text id="150">
	In the Acting Competition, four\nPokémon will perform their moves for\lour panel of Judges.\rThe more a Pokémon stands out, the\nhigher it scores.\rEach Pokémon will get the chance to\nperform four times.\r
</text>
<text id="151">
	Every move has one or more \vFF00\x0001\x0001♥\vFF00\x0001\x0000 marks\nthat indicate the acting score.\rThe more \vFF00\x0001\x0001♥\vFF00\x0001\x0000 marks obtained, the\nhigher the Pokémon scores.\rHowever, Pokémon are not permitted\nto perform the same move two turns\lin a row.\r
</text>
<text id="152">
	There are three Judges in all.\rYou get to choose which one you\nwant to judge your Pokémon.\rTry not to have your Pokémon scored\nby the same Judge as other Pokémon\lso it can stand out more.\rIf your Pokémon leaves a strong\nimpression, it will be rated highly,\learning it more \vFF00\x0001\x0001♥\vFF00\x0001\x0000 marks.\r
</text>
<text id="153">
	Voltage shows the excitement level\nof the Judges.\rIn a Cool Contest, if a Pokémon uses\na Cool move, Voltage goes up.\rHowever, if a Cute or Smart move is\nperformed, the Voltage goes down.\rIf the Voltage reaches 5 points, the\nPokémon earns bonus points.\rIf the Special Judge in the center\nwas chosen, 8 bonus points are\lawarded when the Voltage peaks.\rFor the other Judges, 5 bonus points\nare awarded.\r
</text>
<text id="154">

<text id="1">
	Which Battle Mode would you like\nto play?
</text>
<text id="2">
	There are four Battle Modes.\rSingle Battle is for two Trainers\nwith one or more Pokémon each.\rEach Trainer can have one Pokémon\nin battle at a time.\rDouble Battle is for two Trainers\nwith two or more Pokémon each.\rEach Trainer will send out two\nPokémon to battle at a time.\rMix Battle is for two Trainers\nwith three Pokémon each.\rEach Trainer chooses one of the\nopponent’s Pokémon, mixes them\rwith their own party, and then\nbattles the other Trainer.\rMulti Battle is for four Trainers\nwith one or more Pokémon each.\rEach Trainer can have one Pokémon\nin battle at a time.\r

<text id="23">
	The Battle Tower’s Multi Battle\nRooms are facilities for conducting\lMulti Battles.\rFor Multi Battles, you must partner\nwith a Trainer in the tower and enter\lwith two Pokémon each.\rInside the tower is a room named\nthe Battle Salon where you can meet\lother Trainers.\rThere, you must find a Trainer to act\nas your partner in the Multi Battles.\rOnce you have partnered up, you will\nbe shown to a Multi Battle Room.\rIn the Multi Battle Room, seven\ntag teams await your challenge.\rIf you manage to defeat all seven\nteams, you will earn Battle Points.\rIf you want to interrupt your\nchallenge, please save the game.\rIf you don’t save, you will be\ndisqualified from your challenge.\rAlso, if you are in a tag team with\na friend, you may not interrupt your\lchallenge.\r

<text id="12">
	Marley: ...My \v0100\x0001\x0000 uses\n\v0106\x0001\x0001 well...\rAnd my \v0100\x0001ぁ likes to use\n\v0106\x0001あ.\r...What do you want?\nAm I supposed to go with you?
</text>
<text id="13">
	Marley: ...Whatever...
</text>
<text id="14">
	Marley: ...I’ll go ahead...\r
</text>
<text id="15">
	Mira: Hi, hi!\nI’m with my \v0100\x0001\x0000!\lIt’s really good with \v0106\x0001\x0001!\rThe other one is my \v0100\x0001ぁ.\nIts \v0106\x0001あ is awesome!\r\v0103\x0001ぃ, do you want to\ngo with me?
</text>
<text id="16">
	Mira: Oh, OK.\nLet’s go another time!
</text>
<text id="17">
	Mira: OK! I’ll wait for you!\n\v0103\x0001\x0000, don’t be long!\r
</text>

<file id="341" change="false">
<text id="0">
	Hello there!\nIt’s so very nice to meet you!\rWelcome to the world of Pokémon!\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	My name is Rowan.\rHowever, everyone just calls me\nthe Pokémon Professor.\rBefore I go any further, is this\nyour first adventure?\rIf you need advice, I’m certainly\ncapable of giving it.\r
</text>
<text id="2">
	Moves the main character.\nAlso used to choose various\nheadings and selections.\n\nUsed to confirm a choice, check\nthings, chat, and scroll text.\n\nUsed to exit, cancel a choice,\nand cancel a mode.
</text>
<text id="3">
	Press to open the menu.\n\nPress to use an item, such\nas a Bicycle, that has been\nregistered in advance.
</text>
<text id="4">
	The lower screen is called\nthe Touch Screen.\n\nThe Touch Screen will display\na variety of touch buttons\ndepending on the situation.
</text>
<text id="5">
	If this mark is shown in the\nmessage window, there are active\nbuttons you can touch on the\nTouch Screen below.
</text>
<text id="6">
	\v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="7">
	Do you understand everything\nso far?\v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="8">
	Please touch a button on the\nTouch Screen below.\v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="9">
	Would you like to know more about\nanything else?\r
</text>
<text id="10">
	You are about to enter a world\nwhere you will embark on a grand\nadventure of your very own.
</text>
<text id="11">
	Speak to people and check things\nwherever you go, be it in towns,\nroads, or caves.\nGather information and hints from\nevery possible source.
</text>
<text id="12">
	New paths will open to you when\nyou help people in need, overcome\nchallenges, and solve mysteries.
</text>
<text id="13">
	At times, you will be challenged\nby others to a battle.\nAt other times, wild creatures\nmay stand in your way.\n\nBy overcoming such hurdles,\nyou will gain great power.
</text>
<text id="14">
	However, your adventure is not\nsolely about becoming powerful.
</text>
<text id="15">
	On your travels, we hope that\nyou will meet countless people\nand, through them, achieve\npersonal growth.\n\nThis is the most important\nobjective of this adventure.
</text>
<text id="16">
	This world is widely inhabited by\ncreatures known as Pokémon.\r
</text>
<text id="17">
	Here, I have a Poké Ball.\rTouch the button on the middle of\nthe Poké Ball, if you’d please.\v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="18">
	No, no! Not that button!\nThe button on the Poké Ball.\v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="19">
	We humans live alongside Pokémon\nas friends.\rAt times we play together,\nand at other times we\lwork together.\rSome people use their Pokémon\nto battle and develop\lcloser bonds with them.\rWhat do I do?\rI conduct research so that we may\nlearn more about Pokémon.\r
</text>
<text id="20">
	Now, why don’t you tell me\na little bit about yourself?\r
</text>
<text id="21">
	Are you a boy?\nOr are you a girl?\r
</text>
<text id="22">
	All right, so you’re a boy?\r
</text>
<text id="23">
	All right, so you’re a girl?\r
</text>
<text id="24">
	Tell me, what is your name?\r
</text>
<text id="25">
	Your name is \v0103\x0001\x0000?\r
</text>
<text id="26">
	Your name is \v0103\x0001\x0000?\r
</text>
<text id="27">
	OK...\nSo, you’re \v0103\x0001\x0000?\rA fine name that is!\rNow, this boy here...\nI believe he’s your friend.\r
</text>
<text id="28">
	What might his name be?\r
</text>
<text id="29">
	\v0103\x0001\x0001, is it?\nThat’s your friend’s name?\r
</text>
<text id="30">
	All right, \v0103\x0001\x0000, the time\nhas come.\rYour very own tale of grand\nadventure is about to unfold.\rOn your journey, you will meet\ncountless Pokémon and people.\rI’m sure that along the way you will\ndiscover many things, perhaps even\lsomething about yourself.\rNow, go on, leap into the world of\nPokémon!\r
</text>

</text>
<text id="8">

<file id="372" change="false">
<text id="0">
	This bright red Berry is very spicy and\nhas a provocative flavor. It blooms with\ndelicate, pretty flowers.
</text>
<text id="1">
	This Berry’s thick skin and fruit are\nvery tough and dry tasting. However,\nevery bit of it can be eaten.
</text>
<text id="2">
	Because of its hollow inside pocket,\nthere isn’t a lot to eat. What can be\neaten is very sweet and delicious.
</text>
<text id="3">
	If the leaves grow longer and curlier\nthan average, this Berry will have\na somewhat-bitter taste.
</text>
<text id="4">
	This Berry’s peel is hard, but the flesh\ninside is very juicy. It is distinguished\nby its bracing sourness.
</text>
<text id="5">
	It takes longer to grow than Berries\nsuch as Cheri. The smaller Berries\ntaste better.
</text>
<text id="6">
	Nature’s gifts came together as one in\nthis Berry. It has a wondrous mix of\nflavors that spread in the mouth.
</text>
<text id="7">
	The more this Berry absorbs energy\nfrom sunlight, the more vividly\ncolorful it grows.
</text>
<text id="8">
	This Berry’s gradual process of storing\nnutrients beneficial to Pokémon health\ncauses it to mature slowly.
</text>
<text id="9">
	Sitrus came from the same family as\nOran. It is larger and smoother tasting\nthan Oran.
</text>
<text id="10">
	This Berry is oddly shaped, appearing\nas if someone took a bite out of it.\nIt is packed full of spicy substances.
</text>
<text id="11">
	It is said that this Berry grew lumps\nto help Pokémon grip it, allowing\npropagation farther afield.
</text>
<text id="12">
	This Berry progressively curves as\nit grows. The curvier the Berry, the\nsweeter and tastier.
</text>
<text id="13">
	This Berry turns bitter toward the\nstem. The dainty flower it grows\nfrom doesn’t absorb much sunlight.
</text>
<text id="14">
	This Berry is very big and sour.\nThe juiciness of the pulp accentuates\nthe sourness.
</text>
<text id="15">
	A small hint of spiciness lingers in the\nred granules surrounding this Berry.\nTheir centers have a dry taste.
</text>
<text id="16">
	Though this small, delicately skinned\nBerry is blue in color, it dyes the\nmouth black when eaten.
</text>
<text id="17">
	Bitter, but with a trace of sweetness,\nthe Nanab Berry was the seventh\nto be discovered in the world.
</text>
<text id="18">
	The potent mix of bitter and sour in\nthis Berry seems to promote digestion.\nThe flower is white and beautiful.
</text>
<text id="19">
	It is said that when the sour skin is\npeeled, this spicy Berry can be\ncrushed to make medicine.
</text>
<text id="20">
	When this sweetly spicy Berry’s thick\nskin is peeled, many pieces of the\nfruit spill out.
</text>
<text id="21">
	This Berry can be eaten as is or\nboiled to obtain an extract that adds\na dash of flavor to food.
</text>
<text id="22">
	Even in places of constant rain and\nhigh humidity, this Berry’s plant\ngrows healthy and strong.
</text>
<text id="23">
	This somewhat-rare Berry projects\nan image of luxury, so it is favored\nas a gift item.
</text>
<text id="24">
	One bite of this very tender Berry\nfills the mouth with its sweet\nand tangy flavor.
</text>
<text id="25">
	This Berry is large and spicy. When\neaten during the cold season, it\nwarms the body from inside.
</text>
<text id="26">
	Its dryness is quite strong. As a\nresult, its true deliciousness can’t be\nappreciated by just eating one or two.
</text>
<text id="27">
	The grown-up flavor and dreamy\nsweetness of this Berry make it a\nfavorite of Pokémon everywhere.
</text>
<text id="28">
	Even though it is bitter, it should be\neaten peel and all. The hair on the peel\ncleans the stomach from the inside.
</text>
<text id="29">
	This Berry is quite sour overall, with\nthe sourness especially concentrated\nat the pointed end.
</text>
<text id="30">
	So spicy is the Spelon Berry that, Fire\ntype or not, Pokémon will try to\nbreathe fire after eating a single one.
</text>
<text id="31">
	This Berry drifted from a faraway sea.\nIt is now cultivated in the Sinnoh\nregion.
</text>
<text id="32">
	A bounty of nature that is exceedingly\nsweet. The Berry is huge, with some\ndiscovered that exceed 20 inches.
</text>
<text id="33">
	This Berry is tremendously bitter.\nJust one bite is enough to instantly\nstop hiccups.
</text>
<text id="34">
	This glossy and colorful Berry has a\nmouthwateringly delicious appearance.\nHowever, it is awfully sour.
</text>
<text id="35">
	This Berry is said to have grown\nplentiful in the tropics of the past. It\nboasts an intensely hot spiciness.
</text>
<text id="36">
	This Berry’s flesh is dotted with\ncountless tiny bubbles of air that keep\nit afloat in water.
</text>
<text id="37">
	Energy from lightning strikes is drawn\ninto the plant, making the Berries\ngrow big and rich.
</text>
<text id="38">
	This Berry has a disagreeable “green”\nflavor and scent typical of vegetables.\nIt is rich in health-promoting fiber.
</text>
<text id="39">
	This Berry has a refreshing flavor that\nstrikes a good balance of dryness and\nsourness. It tastes better chilled.
</text>
<text id="40">
	This Berry contains a substance that\ngenerates heat. It can even heat up a\nchilly heart.
</text>
<text id="41">
	This Berry is a brilliant green on the\noutside. Inside, it is packed with a\ndry-flavored, black-colored flesh.
</text>
<text id="42">
	The sweetness-laden pulp has just the\nhint of a hard-edged and fragrant bite\nto it.
</text>
<text id="43">
	This Berry is said to be a new kind\nthat is a cross of two Berries brought\ntogether by winds from far away.
</text>
<text id="44">
	This Berry is said to sense human\nemotions for the way it swells\nroundly when a person approaches.
</text>
<text id="45">
	The flower grows at the tip of this\nBerry. It attracts Bug Pokémon by\nletting its stringy petals stream out.
</text>
<text id="46">
	It is often used for pickles because of\nits very dry flavor. It can also be\neaten raw for its provocative taste.
</text>
<text id="47">
	Considered to have a special power from\nthe olden days, this Berry is sometimes\ndried and used as a good-luck charm.
</text>
<text id="48">
	If a large enough volume of this Berry\nis boiled down, its bitterness fades\naway. It makes a good jam.
</text>
<text id="49">
	Tiny hooks grow on the surface of this\nBerry. It latches on to Pokémon so it\ncan be carried to far-off places.
</text>
<text id="50">
	This Berry is very tough with a strong\nflavor. It was used to make medicine\nby people in the past.
</text>
<text id="51">
	This Berry can be cored out and dried\nto make a whistle. Blowing through its\nhole makes an indescribable sound.
</text>
<text id="52">
	This Berry is surrounded by mystery.\nIt is rumored to be imbued with the\npower of the sea.
</text>
<text id="53">
	This Berry is surrounded by mystery.\nIt is rumored to be imbued with the\npower of the land.
</text>
<text id="54">
	This Berry is surrounded by mystery.\nIt is rumored to be imbued with the\npower of the sky.
</text>
<text id="55">
	This Berry is surrounded by mystery.\nIt is rumored to be imbued with the\npower of all living things.
</text>
<text id="56">
	This is a very, very mystifying Berry.\nThere is no telling how it can be used,\nor what may happen if it is used.
</text>
<text id="57">
	This is said to be a legendary Berry.\nHolding it supposedly brings great\njoy.
</text>
<text id="58">
	This Berry is considered a mirage.\nIt was said to be so strong that it had\nto be abandoned at the world’s edge.
</text>
<text id="59">
	A completely enigmatic Berry.\nIt apparently has the power of the\nstars that fill the night sky.
</text>
<text id="60">
	This Berry has a very dry flavor.\nIt has the effect of making other food\neaten at the same time taste sweet.
</text>
<text id="61">
	The flesh underneath the Custap\nBerry’s tough skin is sweet and\ncreamy soft.
</text>
<text id="62">
	The cluster of drupelets that make\nup this Berry pop rhythmically if\nthe Berry is handled roughly.
</text>
<text id="63">
	In days of old, people worked the top-\nshaped pieces of this Berry free and\nused them as toys.
</text>

<text id="0">
	You haven’t caught all your\nPokémon yet, but...\rWould you like to retire from your\nCatching Show?
</text>
<text id="1">
	I see...\rI’m disappointed that you dropped\nout. Make up for it next time!\r
</text>
<text id="2">
	That’s the spirit, \v0103\x0001\x0000!\nI like how you don’t give up!
</text>
<text id="3">
	That’s the spirit, \v0103\x0001\x0000!\nI like how you don’t give up!
</text>
<text id="4">
	                                    
</text>
<text id="5">
	Ding-dong!\nCongratulations!\r\v0103\x0001\x0000 has successfully\ncaught the stocked Pokémon!\r
</text>
<text id="6">
	                                    
</text>
<text id="7">
	                                      
</text>

<text id="1">
	\v0103\x0001\x0000: Hey, if we run into a\nPokémon, I’m gonna catch it somehow.\rBecause I’m gonna be a Pokémon\nTrainer.\rYou know what a Trainer does, right?\nMakes Pokémon battle and all that?
</text>
<text id="2">
	\v0103\x0001\x0000: Pokémon all have\ndifferent moves, huh?\rA Trainer makes his Pokémon battle\nby ordering them to use moves.\rThat’s so awesomely cool.
</text>
<text id="3">
	\v0103\x0001\x0000: I want Pokémon of my\nown, and not too soon, either.\rI’d be able to go everywhere with my\nPokémon that way.
</text>
<text id="4">
	\v0103\x0001\x0000: That lake has a mirage\nPokémon living in it.\rEveryone says nothing lives there,\nbut I know I’m right.
</text>
<text id="5">
	\v0103\x0001\x0000: I’m gonna become\na Pokémon Trainer for sure.\rNot just any Trainer either.\nI’m going to be the greatest ever.\lThat’s my dream.
</text>
<text id="6">
	\v0103\x0001\x0000: Hey, that’s enough\ntalking already.\rI’m itching to get going to the lake.\nCome on, come on!
</text>
<text id="7">
	\v0103\x0001\x0000: All right!\nLet’s move out! Hustle up!
</text>
<text id="8">
	\v0103\x0001\x0000: We didn’t have any\nchoice in using those people’s\lPokémon, right?\rBut these Pokémon belong to them...\nThey’ll want them back, won’t they?\rBut this is the first Pokémon I’ve\never battled with...
</text>
<text id="9">
	\v0103\x0001\x0000: I wish I could grow\ntougher with this little guy...
</text>
<text id="10">
	\v0103\x0001\x0000: I don’t feel like\ntalking... Let’s go.\r...Are we maybe walking slower than\nwhen we went to the lake?
</text>

	Cheryl: Wait!\nPlease wait, \v0103\x0001\x0000!\rIf you use an Escape Rope now,\nyou know that you’ll leave me behind?
</text>
<text id="12">
	Cheryl: Wait!\nPlease wait, \v0103\x0001\x0000!\rIf you use Teleport now, you know\nthat you’ll leave me behind?
</text>
<text id="13">
	Cheryl: This place...\nThey say it’s a haunted mansion...\rI’m sorry, but it’s too creepy.\nMay we go, please?
</text>
<text id="14">
	Cheryl: It’s startling to see two wild\nPokémon appearing at the same time.
</text>
<text id="15">
	Cheryl: My Pokémon is an excellent\nhealer.\rBut attacking isn’t its strong point.
</text>
<text id="16">
	Cheryl: \v0103\x0001\x0000, battling with\nyou makes me feel elated.\rIf I could predict what you’re about\nto do, we would make a fierce combo!
</text>
<text id="17">
	Cheryl: That’s some nice moss...
</text>
<text id="18">
	Mira: Are you going to use that?\nI will be left all alone...
</text>
<text id="19">
	Mira: Are you going to use that?\nI will be left all alone...
</text>
<text id="20">
	Mira: That isn’t the right way.\nI’ll be lost if we go down...
</text>
<text id="21">
	Mira: I like helpful Pokémon moves\nlike Growl and Minimize.\rThose kinds of moves are my\nfavorites.
</text>
<text id="22">
	Mira: This cave...\nIt’s so easy to get confused here.\lDo you know where we are?
</text>
<text id="23">
	Mira: \v0103\x0001\x0000, did you get to be\nso good because you’re always with\lyour Pokémon?\rYes! That has to be it!\nI will try like you!
</text>

	x\v0133\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="22">
	¥\v0137\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="23">
	YES
</text>
<text id="24">
	NO
</text>
</file>
<file id="489" change="false">
<text id="0">
	You don’t have three Coins.\nYou cannot play right now.
</text>
<text id="1">
	You have 50,000 Coins now.\nYou cannot hold any more.
</text>
<text id="2">
	You have no Coins.\nYou cannot play now.
</text>

<text id="0">
	I’m the Day-Care Man.\rWe look after the precious Pokémon\nof other Trainers.\rIf you’d like us to raise your\nPokémon, have a word with my wife.
</text>
<text id="1">
	Ah, it’s you!\rWe were raising your Pokémon,\nand my goodness, were we surprised!\rYour Pokémon was holding an Egg!\rWe don’t know how it got there,\nbut your Pokémon had it.\rYou do want it, don’t you?
</text>
<text id="2">
	Ah, it’s you! Good to see you.\nYour \v0100\x0001\x0000’s doing just fine.
</text>
<text id="3">
	Well then, I’ll hang on to it.\nThanks!
</text>
<text id="4">
	You have no room for it right now...\nCome back when you’ve made room.
</text>
<text id="5">
	\v0103\x0001\x0000 received the Egg from\nthe Day-Care Man.
</text>
<text id="6">
	You take good care of it.
</text>
<text id="7">
	By the way, I saw your \v0100\x0001\x0000\ncavorting with \v0103\x0001\x0001’s\l\v0100\x0001ぁ.\rI may even have seen it receiving\na piece of Mail.
</text>
<text id="8">
	If you want to pick up your Pokémon,\nhave a word with my wife.
</text>
<text id="9">
	Ah, it’s you!\nGood to see you!\rYour \v0100\x0001\x0000 and \v0100\x0001\x0001\nare doing just fine.\r
</text>
<text id="10">
	I really will keep it.\nYou do want this, yes?
</text>
<text id="11">
	The two seem to get along very well.
</text>
<text id="12">
	The two seem to get along.
</text>
<text id="13">
	The two don’t seem to like each\nother much.
</text>
<text id="14">
	The two prefer to play with other\nPokémon more than with each other.
</text>
<text id="15">
	I’m the Day-Care Lady.\nWe can raise Pokémon for you.\rWould you like us to raise your\nPokémon?
</text>
<text id="16">
	Which Pokémon should we raise for\nyou?\r
</text>
<text id="17">
	Fine, we’ll raise your \v0100\x0001\x0000\nfor a while.\rCome back for it later.\r
</text>
<text id="18">
	We can raise two of your Pokémon.\nWould you like us to raise another?
</text>
<text id="19">
	Ah, there you are!\nMy husband was looking for you.
</text>
<text id="20">
	Oh, fine, then.\nCome again.
</text>
<text id="21">
	You don’t have enough money...
</text>
<text id="22">
	Do you want to take back the other\none, too?
</text>
<text id="23">
	Very good.\nCome again.
</text>
<text id="24">
	Ah, it’s you! Good to see you.\nNow, about your Pokémon...\r
</text>
<text id="25">
	By level, your \v0100\x0001\x0000 has\ngrown by about \v0133\x0001\x0001.\r
</text>
<text id="26">
	Your Pokémon team is full.\nMake room, then come see me.
</text>
<text id="27">
	Which Pokémon will you take back?
</text>
<text id="28">
	If you want your \v0100\x0001\x0000 back,\nit will cost ¥\v0135\x0001\x0001.
</text>
<text id="29">
	Excellent!\nHere’s your Pokémon.\r
</text>
<text id="30">
	\v0103\x0001\x0001 took \v0100\x0001\x0000 back\nfrom the Day-Care Lady.\r
</text>
<text id="31">
	Oh? But you only have one\nPokémon with you.\rYou can’t go off without a Pokémon.\nCome back another time.
</text>
<text id="32">
	Do you want your Pokémon back?
</text>
<text id="33">
	If you leave me that Pokémon,\nwhat are you gonna battle with?\rCome back another time.
</text>
<text id="34">
	Huh? Now, now.\rIf you leave that Pokémon with\nme, you’ll be left with just one.\rYou will be better off if you catch\nsome more, if I do say so myself.
</text>
<text id="35">
	Now, now.\nThat is merely an Egg!
</text>
<text id="36">
	Fine, we’ll raise your \v0100\x0001\x0000\nfor a while.\rCome back for it later.
</text>
<text id="37">
	Huh?
</text>
<text id="38">
	Lv. \v0134\x0001\x0001

<text id="0">
	\vFF00\x0001\x0001Pokémon Diamond\vFF00\x0001\x0000

<text id="1">
	\vFF00\x0001\x0001Pokémon Pearl\vFF00\x0001\x0000

<text id="2">
	\vFF00\x0001\x0001Credits\vFF00\x0001\x0000

</text>

<file id="496" change="false">
<text id="0">
	Dawn: Hey, \v0103\x0001\x0000?\nThe professor told me something.\rHe thinks \v0100\x0001\x0001 may have\nreappeared at the Spear Pillar...
</text>
<text id="1">
	Dawn: Hi, \v0103\x0001\x0000!\rYou’re friends with the elder of\nCelestic Town, aren’t you?\rShe told me that she had something\nshe wanted to show you.
</text>
<text id="2">
	Dawn: Hi, \v0103\x0001\x0000!\nMay I see your Pokédex?\r...\rOh, my gosh! You’ve seen every kind\nof Pokémon in Sinnoh!\rHave you shown your Pokédex to\nProf. Rowan yet?
</text>
<text id="3">
	Dawn: Hey, \v0103\x0001\x0000, have you\never chatted with my kid sister?
</text>
<text id="4">
	Dawn: Oh, \v0103\x0001\x0000, are you\nacquainted with Bebe?\rShe lives in Hearthome City.\rEvery Trainer should make it a point\nto pay Bebe a visit.
</text>
<text id="5">
	Dawn: Hey! \v0103\x0001\x0000, you’ve got\na Poké Radar?\rWatch for tall grass to rustle wildly\nwhen you use your Poké Radar.\rThat could be a sign that a rare\nPokémon is hiding in there.
</text>
<text id="6">
	Dawn: Hi, \v0103\x0001\x0000!\nHow’s your Poké Radar?\rWhen you use it, do you sometimes\nsee more than one patch of tall\lgrass rustling?\rThe patch farther away gives you a\nbetter chance of seeing the same\lkind of Pokémon in a row.\rThat’s the feeling I get, anyways.
</text>
<text id="7">
	Dawn: Sometimes a patch of grass\nsparkles when a Poké Radar is used.\rPeople say a different-colored\nPokémon is hiding there!\rCould that be true?
</text>
<text id="8">
	Dawn: So, \v0103\x0001\x0000.\rI’m also helping the professor put\ntogether the National Pokédex.\rCatching Pokémon can be really\nchallenging, can’t it?\rBut, it’s also so much fun!
</text>
<text id="9">
	Dawn: \v0103\x0001\x0000!\r\v0103\x0001\x0000, \v0103\x0001\x0000,\n\v0103\x0001\x0000!\rCongratulations for completing\nthe National Pokédex!
</text>
<text id="10">
	Dawn: Is today maybe...\nYour birthday, \v0103\x0001\x0000?
</text>
<text id="11">
	Dawn: Giggle...\nCongratulations, \v0103\x0001\x0000!\lAnd many more happy returns!
</text>
<text id="12">
	Dawn: Oh, it isn’t?\rI wonder what made me think that\ntoday was your birthday?
</text>
<text id="13">
	Dawn: \v0103\x0001\x0000!\nI heard from the professor!\rCongratulations, Champ!
</text>
<text id="14">
	Lucas: Hey, \v0103\x0001\x0000!\nThe prof told me something cool.\rHe thinks \v0100\x0001\x0001 has\nreappeared at the Spear Pillar!
</text>
<text id="15">
	Lucas: Hi, \v0103\x0001\x0000!\rYou know the elder of Celestic Town,\nright?\rShe told me she wanted to show you\nsomething.
</text>
<text id="16">
	Lucas: Hey, \v0103\x0001\x0000!\nLet me take a look at your Pokédex.\r...\rAwesome! You’ve seen every kind\nof Pokémon in Sinnoh!\rHave you shown this Pokédex to\nProf. Rowan yet?
</text>
<text id="17">
	Lucas: Hey, \v0103\x0001\x0000, have you\never seen my kid sister?
</text>
<text id="18">
	Lucas: Hey, \v0103\x0001\x0000, have you\nmet Bebe?\rShe lives out in Hearthome City.\rIf you’re a Trainer, you owe it to\nyourself to visit her.
</text>
<text id="19">
	Lucas: Hey! \v0103\x0001\x0000, you’ve got\nyourself a Poké Radar, too?\rWatch for tall grass to rustle wildly\nwhen you use that Poké Radar.\rThat’s a sign that rare Pokémon\nmay be hiding there.
</text>
<text id="20">
	Lucas: Hi, \v0103\x0001\x0000!\nHow’s your Poké Radar working out?\rWhen you use it, do you sometimes\nsee more than one patch of tall\lgrass rustling?\rThe patch farther away gives you a\nbetter chance of seeing the same\lkind of Pokémon right in a row.\rI think that’s how it goes.
</text>
<text id="21">
	Lucas: Sometimes a patch of grass\nsparkles when a Poké Radar is used.\rThey say a different-colored\nPokémon is hiding there!\rI wonder if that’s true?
</text>
<text id="22">
	Lucas: So, \v0103\x0001\x0000.\rI’m also helping the professor out\nwith the National Pokédex.\rCatching Pokémon can be really\nchallenging, can’t it?\rBut I also have a ton of fun doing it!
</text>
<text id="23">
	Lucas: \v0103\x0001\x0000!\rWow! I don’t know what to say!\nI mean, it’s so awesome and all...\rSincerely, congratulations for\ncompleting the National Pokédex!
</text>
<text id="24">
	Lucas: Hey, \v0103\x0001\x0000?\nIs it maybe your birthday today?
</text>
<text id="25">
	Lucas: I thought so!\nCongratulations, \v0103\x0001\x0000!\lYou know, I’m glad we’re friends!
</text>
<text id="26">
	Lucas: Huh?\nIt isn’t?\rNow, what made me think it was\nyour birthday? Freaky weird.
</text>
<text id="27">
	Lucas: \v0103\x0001\x0000!\nThe professor told me the news!\rCongratulations, Champ!
</text>

<file id="498" change="false">
<text id="0">
	\vFF01\x0001ｃThud!!\vFF01\x0001コ\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	\v0103\x0001\x0000: What was that about?!\rOh, hey, \v0103\x0001\x0001!\rHey! I’m going to the lake!\nYou come too! And be quick about it!\rOK, \v0103\x0001\x0001? I’m fining\nyou ¥1 million if you’re late!\r
</text>
<text id="2">
	\v0103\x0001\x0000: Oh, jeez!\nForgot something!\r

<text id="0">
	Here I come!
</text>
<text id="1">
	Yeah!\r
</text>
<text id="2">
	Bleah!\r
</text>
<text id="3">
	Hey, rookie!\nBring it on!
</text>
<text id="4">
	Yeah, I knew it.\nYou’re a rookie after all.\r
</text>
<text id="5">
	Bleah!\nYou’re just a rookie!\r
</text>
<text id="6">
	I gotta say it, shorts are the best!\nThey remain comfy and easy to wear!
</text>
<text id="7">
	Shorts are the greatest!\r
</text>
<text id="8">
	I’ll never stop wearing shorts.\nNot for anybody!\r
</text>
<text id="9">
	I make it a policy to wear\nminiskirts!
</text>
<text id="10">
	Miniskirts are the ultimate!\r
</text>
<text id="11">
	What’s your policy?\r
</text>
<text id="12">
	I love my miniskirt!
</text>
<text id="13">
	Caught you snoozing!\r
</text>
<text id="14">
	Miniskirts make legs look longer!\nIs that a good thing?\r
</text>
<text id="15">
	I’m on the lookout for adorable\naccessories.
</text>
<text id="16">
	Let me know if you find any nice\naccessories!\r
</text>
<text id="17">
	I wish I could dress up!\r
</text>
<text id="18">
	I want to test out something I\nlearned at private school.
</text>
<text id="19">
	Yes!\nIt worked perfectly!\r
</text>
<text id="20">
	Hmm...\nSomething’s wrong here.\r
</text>
<text id="21">
	Uh... Wroar!
</text>
<text id="22">
	A battle is about momentum and\nwillpower.\r
</text>
<text id="23">
	OK, so willpower doesn’t cut it on\nits own.\r
</text>
<text id="24">
	I study every day because I want to\nwork all over the world.
</text>
<text id="25">
	My dream is worldwide!\r
</text>
<text id="26">
	I need to study up on Pokémon\nbattles.\r
</text>
<text id="27">
	When I grow up, I’m going to be a\nPokémon professor!
</text>
<text id="28">
	Er-hem! Er-hem!\nYou’ve much to learn, youngster!\r
</text>
<text id="29">
	Er-hem! Er-hem!\nSeems I’ve much to learn still!\r
</text>

	When the subject is Pokémon, I simply\ndon’t lose!
</text>

	It’s a victory of knowledge!\r
</text>
<text id="32">
	I’m going to review the subject!\nAnd I’ll subject you to my revenge!\r
</text>
<text id="33">
	Oh, now you look wimpy.\nI might win this.
</text>
<text id="34">
	I so did it!\r
</text>
<text id="35">
	Ouch, that hurt.\r
</text>
<text id="36">

</text>
<text id="37">
	It’s fine, fine.\nYou tried your best, I know.\r
</text>
<text id="38">
	It’s fine, fine...\nNo need to say a word...\r
</text>
<text id="39">
	I’m rich!
</text>
<text id="40">
	Well, of course.\nI’m rich.\r
</text>
<text id="41">
	What happened?\nI’m rich, aren’t I?\r
</text>
<text id="42">
	Hmm. So, you’re good, huh?
</text>
<text id="43">
	Hmm. You’re no big deal.\nHmm?\r
</text>
<text id="44">
	Hmm. So, you are good.\nHmm.\r
</text>
<text id="45">
	Oh, yes.\nI shall attack now.
</text>
<text id="46">
	I’ve done it!\r
</text>
<text id="47">
	Oh, how disappointing.\r
</text>
<text id="48">
	Over it is, your adventure.\nCome hither and get whupped!
</text>
<text id="49">
	A done deal, it was.\r
</text>
<text id="50">
	Oh, how vexing this so is.\nVerily, I thank you.\r
</text>
<text id="51">
	How boring...
</text>
<text id="52">
	So truly boring...\r
</text>
<text id="53">
	That was a good way to waste some\ntime.\r
</text>
<text id="54">
	Hunh?\nWhere is everyone?
</text>
<text id="55">
	Hey, guys!\nWhere are you?!\r
</text>
<text id="56">
	I came to camp, but I think I got\nseparated from my friends...\r
</text>
<text id="57">
	Oh!\nYou have a Pokétch too?

	A small path through a lush, green,\nwooded area. The densely grown trees\ngive off a thick aroma.

<text id="7">

</text>
<text id="8">

<text id="12">

<text id="16">
	The streams forded by this path wind\npast copses and grassy patches in\na serene and soothing manner.

<text id="17">
	The Lost Tower is where Pokémon are\nlaid to rest when their lives come\nto an end.
</text>
<text id="18">
	A path made by clearing an overgrown\ncanyon between mountains. It is always\nshrouded by a dense fog.
</text>
<text id="19">
	Grandma Wilma’s house stands alone in an\nisolated spot deep among mountains.

<text id="21">

<text id="22">

</text>

</text>
<text id="24">

</text>
<text id="25">

<text id="30">

<text id="2301">
	By battling tough opponents, both\npeople and Pokémon grow tough!\r
</text>
<text id="2302">
	My, you are tough.\n

<text id="2303">
	Yo, Pokémon-riding Trainer!\nHow about a rematch?\r
</text>
<text id="2304">
	Awesome!\nYou’re a real wild child!\n

<text id="2305">

<text id="2315">

<text id="2333">

<file id="562" change="false">
<text id="0">
	Hello!\nI’m with Jubilife TV!\rMay I hit you up for a quick\ninterview?
</text>
<text id="1">
	Oh, that’s too bad.\nI hope you can oblige another time!
</text>
<text id="2">
	Thank you for sharing your thoughts\nwith us.\rWe’ll be featuring this interview in\nan upcoming TV program.\rPlease do tune in and see how you\nlook on TV!
</text>
<text id="3">
	       
</text>
<text id="4">
	Thank you very much!\nLet’s not waste any time...\rSo, may I hear about your Battle\nTower challenge?\rCan you tell me what you’re feeling\nnow?\r
</text>
<text id="5">
	       
</text>
<text id="6">
	Thank you very much!\nLet’s not waste any time...\rYour \v0100\x0001\x0000 is quite appealing,\nisn’t it?\rMay I have your comment on your\n\v0100\x0001\x0000?\r
</text>
<text id="7">
	       
</text>
<text id="8">
	Thank you very much!\nLet’s not waste any time...\rMay I ask you which Pokétch app you\nuse the most?\r...The \v0118\x0001\x0000...\nI see!\rMay I have your comment on\nthe \v0118\x0001\x0000?\r
</text>
<text id="9">

	A single-use drill to drill a hole in\nthe wall for your Secret Base.
</text>
<text id="68">
	Close the Bag.
</text>

<text id="91">
	Roark: Hey! \v0103\x0001\x0000!\nIs this maybe your first time here?\rWelcome to Sinnoh’s Underground!\rHuh? Where is this, you ask?\nDoesn’t the Radar make it obvious?\rThis is a giant underground network\nof passages underneath Sinnoh.\rHuh? What am I doing down in this\nexpanse of a place?\rThat’s kind of hard to answer.\rI mean, you can do pretty much\nanything you want down here.\rFor instance, you can dig up Treasure,\nSpheres, and make a Secret Base.\rYou can play with your friends down\nhere, too.\rYou should talk to the Underground\nMan in Eterna City.\rI have to get going now.\nI’ll see you around!
</text>

</text>

<text id="399">

<text id="400">

<text id="1">
	For some time after its birth, it\ngrows by gaining nourishment from\nthe seed on its back.
</text>
<text id="2">
	When the bud on its back starts\nswelling, a sweet aroma wafts to\nindicate the flower’s coming bloom.
</text>
<text id="3">
	After a rainy day, the flower on\nits back smells stronger. The\nscent attracts other Pokémon.
</text>
<text id="4">
	The fire on the tip of its tail is a\nmeasure of its life. If healthy,\nits tail burns intensely.
</text>
<text id="5">
	In the rocky mountains where\nCHARMELEON live, their fiery\ntails shine at night like stars.
</text>
<text id="6">
	It is said that CHARIZARD’s fire\nburns hotter if it has\nexperienced harsh battles.
</text>
<text id="7">
	It shelters itself in its shell,\nthen strikes back with spouts of\nwater at every opportunity.
</text>
<text id="8">
	It is said to live 10,000 years.\nIts furry tail is popular as a\nsymbol of longevity.
</text>
<text id="9">
	The jets of water it spouts from\nthe rocket cannons on its shell\ncan punch through thick steel.
</text>
<text id="10">
	It releases a stench from its red\nantenna to repel enemies. It\ngrows by molting repeatedly.
</text>
<text id="11">
	A steel-hard shell protects its\ntender body. It quietly endures\nhardships while awaiting evolution.
</text>
<text id="12">
	It loves the honey of flowers and\ncan locate flower patches that\nhave even tiny amounts of pollen.
</text>
<text id="13">
	It eats its weight in leaves every\nday. It fends off attackers with\nthe needle on its head.
</text>
<text id="14">
	While awaiting evolution, it\nhides from predators under\nleaves and in nooks of branches.
</text>
<text id="15">
	Its best attack involves flying\naround at high speed, striking with\npoison needles, then flying off.
</text>
<text id="16">
	It is docile and prefers to avoid\nconflict. If disturbed, however,\nit can ferociously strike back.
</text>
<text id="17">
	It flies over its wide territory in\nsearch of prey, downing it\nwith its highly developed claws.
</text>
<text id="18">
	By flapping its wings with all its\nmight, PIDGEOT can make a gust of\nwind capable of bending tall trees.
</text>
<text id="19">
	Cautious in the extreme, its\nhardy vitality lets it live in\nany kind of environment.
</text>
<text id="20">
	It whittles its constantly growing\nfangs by gnawing on hard things.\nIt can chew apart cinder walls.
</text>
<text id="21">
	It flaps its small wings busily to\nfly. Using its beak, it searches\nin grass for prey.
</text>
<text id="22">
	It has the stamina to fly all\nday on its broad wings. It\nfights by using its sharp beak.
</text>
<text id="23">
	It sneaks through grass without\nmaking a sound and strikes\nunsuspecting prey from behind.
</text>
<text id="24">
	The pattern on its belly is for\nintimidation. It constricts foes\nwhile they are frozen in fear.
</text>
<text id="25">
	It lives in forests with others.\nIt stores electricity in the\npouches on its cheeks.
</text>
<text id="26">
	It turns aggressive if it has too\nmuch electricity in its body. It\ndischarges power through its tail.
</text>
<text id="27">
	To protect itself from attackers,\nit curls up into a ball. It lives in\narid regions with minimal rainfall.
</text>
<text id="28">
	It curls up, then rolls into foes\nwith its back. Its sharp spines\ninflict severe damage.
</text>
<text id="29">
	While it does not prefer to fight,\neven one drop of the poison it\nsecretes from barbs can be fatal.
</text>
<text id="30">
	When it senses danger, it raises\nall the barbs on its body. These\nbarbs grow slower than NIDORINO’s.
</text>
<text id="31">
	Its entire body is armored with\nhard scales. It will protect the\nyoung in its burrow with its life.
</text>
<text id="32">
	It scans its surroundings by\nraising its ears out of the grass.\nIts toxic horn is for protection.
</text>
<text id="33">
	It has a violent disposition and\nstabs foes with its horn, which\noozes poison upon impact.
</text>
<text id="34">
	One swing of its mighty tail can\nsnap a telephone pole as if it were\na matchstick.
</text>
<text id="35">
	Thought to live with others on\nquiet mountains, it is popular\nfor its adorable nature.
</text>
<text id="36">
	Rarely seen by people, it is\nsaid to be drawn by the full\nmoon to play at deserted lakes.
</text>
<text id="37">
	It controls balls of fire. As it\ngrows, its six tails split from\ntheir tips to make more tails.
</text>
<text id="38">
	Its nine tails are said to be\nimbued with a mystic power.\nIt can live for a thousand years.
</text>
<text id="39">
	When it wavers its big, round\neyes, it begins singing a lullaby\nthat makes everyone drowsy.
</text>
<text id="40">
	Its fine fur feels sublime to the\ntouch. It can expand its body by\ninhaling air.
</text>
<text id="41">
	Even though it has no eyes, it can\nsense obstacles using ultrasonic\nwaves it emits from its mouth.
</text>
<text id="42">
	It loves the blood of humans and\nPokémon. It flies around at night\nin search of neck veins.
</text>
<text id="43">
	It often plants its root feet in the\nground during the day and sows\nseeds as it walks about at night.
</text>
<text id="44">
	The honey it drools from its mouth\nsmells so atrocious, it can curl\nnoses more than a mile away.
</text>
<text id="45">
	Its petals are the largest in the\nworld. As it walks, it scatters\nextremely allergenic pollen.
</text>
<text id="46">
	Mushrooms named tochukaso grow\non its back. They grow along\nwith the host PARAS.
</text>
<text id="47">
	A mushroom grown larger than the\nhost’s body controls PARASECT.\nIt scatters poisonous spores.
</text>
<text id="48">
	Its big eyes are actually clusters\nof tiny eyes. At night, its kind is\ndrawn by light.
</text>
<text id="49">
	It flutters its wings to scatter\ndustlike scales. The scales leach\ntoxins if they contact skin.
</text>
<text id="50">
	A Pokémon that lives underground.\nBecause of its dark habitat, it is\nrepelled by bright sunlight.
</text>
<text id="51">
	Its three heads move alternately,\ndriving it through tough soil to\ndepths of over 60 miles.
</text>
<text id="52">
	It is nocturnal in nature. If it\nspots something shiny, its eyes\nglitter brightly.
</text>
<text id="53">
	A very haughty Pokémon. Among\nfans, the size of the jewel in its\nforehead is a topic of much talk.
</text>
<text id="54">
	If its usual headache worsens, it\nstarts exhibiting odd powers. It\ncan’t remember doing so, however.
</text>
<text id="55">
	A Pokémon that lives in lakes.\nIt swims faster than any human\nswimming champion.
</text>
<text id="56">
	It lives in treetop colonies.\nIf one becomes enraged, the whole\ncolony rampages for no reason.
</text>
<text id="57">
	It grows angry if you see its eyes\nand gets angrier if you run. If you\nbeat it, it gets even madder.
</text>
<text id="58">
	A Pokémon with a loyal nature.\nIt will remain motionless until it is\ngiven an order by its Trainer.
</text>
<text id="59">
	Its proud and regal appearance\nhas captured the hearts of\npeople since long ago.
</text>
<text id="60">
	Its skin is so thin, its internal\norgans are visible. It has trouble\nwalking on its newly grown feet.
</text>
<text id="61">
	The spiral pattern on its belly\nsubtly undulates. Staring at it\ngradually causes drowsiness.
</text>
<text id="62">
	With its extremely tough muscles,\nit can keep swimming in the Pacific\nOcean without resting.
</text>
<text id="63">
	It sleeps for 18 hours a day.\nEven when awake, it teleports\nitself while remaining seated.
</text>
<text id="64">
	If one is nearby, an eerie shadow\nappears on TV screens. Seeing the\nshadow is said to bring bad luck.
</text>
<text id="65">
	Its superb memory lets it recall\neverything it has experienced from\nbirth. Its IQ exceeds 5,000.
</text>
<text id="66">
	It hefts a GRAVELER repeatedly to\nstrengthen its entire body. It\nuses every type of martial arts.
</text>
<text id="67">
	MACHOKE’s boundless power is very\ndangerous, so it wears a belt that\nsuppresses its energy.
</text>
<text id="68">
	It punches with its four arms at\nblinding speed. It can launch\n1,000 punches in two seconds.
</text>
<text id="69">
	It prefers hot and humid\nenvironments. It is quick at\ncapturing prey with its vines.
</text>
<text id="70">
	A Pokémon that appears to be a\nplant. It captures unwary prey by\ndousing them with a toxic powder.
</text>
<text id="71">
	It pools in its mouth a fluid with\na honeylike scent, which is really\nan acid that dissolves anything.
</text>
<text id="72">
	Its body is virtually composed of\nwater. It shoots strange beams\nfrom its crystal-like eyes.
</text>
<text id="73">
	With 80 tentacles for ensnaring\nvictims, it prevents escape until\nthe prey is weakened by poison.
</text>
<text id="74">
	Many live on mountain trails\nand remain half buried while\nkeeping an eye on climbers.
</text>
<text id="75">
	GRAVELER make their homes on\nsheer cliff faces by gouging out\nnumerous horizontal holes.
</text>
<text id="76">
	It sheds its hide once a year.\nIts boulderlike body is so tough,\neven dynamite can’t harm it.
</text>
<text id="77">
	About an hour after birth, its\nfiery mane and tail grow out,\ngiving it an impressive appearance.
</text>
<text id="78">
	It gallops at nearly 150 mph.\nWith its mane blazing ferociously,\nit races as if it were an arrow.
</text>
<text id="79">
	Although slow, it is skilled at\nfishing with its tail. It does not\nfeel pain if its tail is bitten.
</text>
<text id="80">
	Though usually dim witted, it\nseems to become inspired if the\nSHELLDER on its tail bites down.
</text>
<text id="81">
	The units at its sides generate\nelectromagnetic waves that keep it\nairborne. It feeds on electricity.
</text>
<text id="82">
	It is actually three MAGNEMITE\nlinked by magnetism. A group can\nset off a magnetic storm.
</text>
<text id="83">
	It can’t live without the stalk it\nholds. That’s why it defends the\nstalk from attackers with its life.
</text>
<text id="84">
	The brains in its two heads appear\nto communicate emotions to each\nother with a telepathic power.
</text>
<text id="85">
	When DODUO evolves into this odd\nbreed, one of its heads splits into\ntwo. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
</text>
<text id="86">
	A Pokémon that lives on icebergs.\nIt swims in the sea using the point\non its head to break up ice.
</text>
<text id="87">
	In snow, the pure white coat\ncovering its body obscures it from\npredators.
</text>
<text id="88">
	It was born when sludge in a dirty\nstream was exposed to the moon’s\nX-rays. It appears among filth.
</text>
<text id="89">
	A toxic fluid seeps from its body.\nThe fluid instantly kills plants and\ntrees on contact.
</text>
<text id="90">
	It swims backward by opening and\nclosing its two shells. Its large\ntongue is always kept hanging out.
</text>
<text id="91">
	It fights by keeping its shell\ntightly shut for protection and\nby shooting spikes to repel foes.
</text>
<text id="92">
	This Pokémon’s body is 95% made up\nof gases, which are blown away by\nstrong gusts of wind.
</text>
<text id="93">
	It can slip through any obstacle.\nIt lurks inside walls to keep an\neye on its foes.
</text>
<text id="94">
	It hides in shadows. It is said\nthat if GENGAR is hiding, it cools\nthe area by nearly 10 degrees F.
</text>
<text id="95">
	When it travels underground, it\ncauses rumbling and tremors.\nIt can move at 50 mph.
</text>
<text id="96">
	It can tell what people are\ndreaming by sniffing with its big\nnose. It loves fun dreams.
</text>
<text id="97">
	Seeing its swinging pendulum can\ninduce sleep in three seconds,\neven in someone who just woke up.
</text>
<text id="98">
	It lives in burrows dug on sandy\nbeaches. Its pincers fully grow\nback if they are broken in battle.
</text>
<text id="99">
	The larger pincer has 10,000-\nhorsepower strength. However, it\nis so heavy, it is difficult to aim.
</text>
<text id="100">
	It looks just like a Poké Ball.\nIt is dangerous because it may\nelectrocute or explode on touch.
</text>
<text id="101">
	It is known to drift on winds if it\nis bloated to bursting with stored\nelectricity.
</text>
<text id="102">
	Its six eggs converse using\ntelepathy. They can quickly gather\nif they become separated.
</text>
<text id="103">
	It is called “The Walking Jungle.”\nIf a head grows too big, it falls\noff and becomes an EXEGGCUTE.
</text>
<text id="104">
	When it thinks of its dead mother,\nit cries. Its crying makes the\nskull it wears rattle hollowly.

<file id="616" change="false">
<text id="0">
	
</text>
<text id="1">
	For some time after its birth, it\ngrows by gaining nourishment from\nthe seed on its back.
</text>
<text id="2">
	When the bud on its back starts\nswelling, a sweet aroma wafts to\nindicate the flower’s coming bloom.
</text>
<text id="3">
	After a rainy day, the flower on\nits back smells stronger. The\nscent attracts other Pokémon.
</text>
<text id="4">
	The fire on the tip of its tail is a\nmeasure of its life. If healthy,\nits tail burns intensely.
</text>
<text id="5">

</text>
<text id="77">
	Se pasa 20 horas al día durmiendo.\nUna de sus habilidades es hacer que\nle entre sueño al que tiene al lado.
</text>
<text id="78">
	はなの\x0001かおりを\x0001かぐと\x0001きもちが\nリラックスする。かおりの\x0001つよい\nロゼリアは\x0001げんきな\x0001しょうこ。
</text>
<text id="79">
	Its flowers give off a relaxing fragrance.\nThe stronger its aroma, the healthier\nthe ROSELIA is.
</text>
<text id="80">
	Ses fleurs dégagent un parfum relaxant.\nPlus fort est cet arôme, et plus ROSELIA\nest en bonne santé.
</text>
<text id="81">
	Seine Blüte verströmt einen entspannenden\nDuft. Je stärker dieser Duft ist, desto\ngesünder ist ROSELIA.
</text>
<text id="82">
	Dai suoi fiori si diffonde una fragranza\nrilassante. Più intenso è il profumo,\npiù questo POKéMON è forte.
</text>
<text id="83">
	Las flores que tiene desprenden un aroma\nrelajante. Cuanto más intenso, mejor es el\nestado de salud de ROSELIA.
</text>
